abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column recalls righteous outrage over high crime rates that pervaded city in 1990 and sometimes led to serious errors; holds false confessions of men convicted that year in case of Central Park jogger should be kept in mind in matter of Johnny Hincapie, who hopes to overturn his conviction for being part of mugging and murder of tourist Brian Watkins.
lead_paragraph: Once considered airtight, some confessions in the 1990s — the high tide of rampage and murder in modern New York — have led to grave errors.

headline.main: Confessions From New York’s Era of Fury Show Their Cracks
headline.print_headline: Confessions In Era of Fury Show Cracks

snippet: Once considered airtight, some confessions in the 1990s — the high tide of rampage and murder in modern New York — have led to grave errors.
